definition[0]: an official order or decision, especially one made by the ruler of a country
example[0]: The Emperor issued the decree repealing martial law.
definition[1]: a judgment in a court of law
definition[2]: to make an official judgment or give an official order
example[1]: The King decreed that there should be an end to the fighting.
definition[3]: a judgement made in a court of law after a CIVIL action
example[2]: The council had already been successful in obtaining a court decree against the former MP.
definition[4]: in certain forms of government, an order from a president, minister etc that has the force of a law
example[3]: The president issued a decree on January 26, ordering the re-registration of all political parties.
